methods.isLocalPath:
A URI is a "local path" when the only components are scheme and path; and path starts with "/".

:param uri: (java.net.URI) - the URI
:return: (boolean) true if uri is a "local path"
methods.isRemotePath:
A URI is a "remote path" when the only components are scheme, host,
 and path; and path starts with "/".

:param uri: (java.net.URI) - the URI
:return: (boolean) true if uri is a "remote path"
methods.isRemoteQuery:
A URI is a "remote query" when the only components are scheme, host, query, and path; and path is empty.

:param uri: (java.net.URI) - the URI
:return: (boolean) true if uri is a "remote query"
methods.isRemoteTarget:
A URI is a "remote target" when the only components are scheme, host, and path; and path is empty.

:param uri: (java.net.URI) - the URI
:return: (boolean) true if uri is a "remote target"
